info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:31PM EDT until June 01 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL ROCKINGHAM...NORTHWESTERN ALBEMARLE AND EAST CENTRAL AUGUSTA COUNTIES... At 330 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Crimora, or 8 miles north of Waynesboro, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Grottoes, Crimora, Verona, Weyers Cave, New Hope, Port Republic and Staunton Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
